title: Unable to Connect to the server, Please check your network connection and attempt to reconnect--
body:
I'm attempting to play League of Legends at a different location than I normally use.  On all game types, after the champion selection screen when the client launches I get a black screen instead of the typical loading screen and game.  After several seconds the game will crash, leaving the message   

"Unable to Connect to the server, Please check your network connection and attempt to reconnect to the game".  

I have verified that the game still works perfectly fine on my home network and one other however it continues to have this error at the new location.  I have edited my computers internal firewall to allow the League of Legends client access and nothing changed. (To be expected since it is being listed as a network error)
I have reinstalled the game just to be safe.

Does anybody know what network settings I need to change in order to allow League access?  I have administrator permissions for the router, I just need to know whether it's a matter of simply port-forwarding or something else entirely.

If anybody knows what's wrong, please help.

replies.body: I'd try out the steps on Port Forwarding and DNS settings in our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) first. If that doesn't help, hit me back up and we can dig a little more.
So I had it working, but the problem has returned. I'm using a static IP and have opened all necessary ports but I still receive the connection issue.

Hmmmm something more elaborate must be going on with that network. Go ahead and hit up our tech guys in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) with some network logs. They'll be able to look over those to see what's going wrong.
